Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.expander_cycle_test.expander_cycle_test

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.system.system_config import SystemConfig
import time



[docs]class ExpanderCycleTest(TestBase):


[docs]    def __init__(self):
        super(ExpanderCycleTest, self).__init__()
        self.cycle_count = self.test_control["cycle_count"]
        self.with_expander = self.test_control["with_expander"]
        self.bridge_setting = self.test_control["bridge_setting"]
        self.error_filter = self.test_control["error_filter"]
        self.gpu_count = self.test_control["gpu_count"]
        self.fail_stop = self.test_control["fail_stop"]
        self.cycle_type = self.test_control["cycle_type"]
        self.ac_command = self.test_control["ac_command"]



[docs]    def exception_handler(self, error, muststop):
        # parse the error string and increment error counter
        self.error_counter += 1
        self.err_str += "Error number %d:\n" % self.error_counter
        self.err_str += str(error)
        self.err_str += "\n"
        # muststop disregard fail_stop value, it stop the program when critical
        # failures happen: power on/off, GPU not detected, etc.
        if muststop:
            raise Exception(self.err_str)
        else:
            # get failure stop status
            fail_stop = self.fail_stop
            # if we want to stop executing on non-critical errors
            if fail_stop:
                raise Exception(self.err_str)
            # if we don't want to stop on non-critical errors
            else:
                self.log_info(str(error))



[docs]    def check_expander_status(self, status):
        # generate cmd to check power on succeeded on expander box
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        cmd = bridge_setting + ' power status'
        out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
        pass_condition = 'Chassis Power is ' + status.strip()
        if out == pass_condition:
            return True
        else:
            return False



[docs]    def expander_on(self):
        # get bridge setting
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        # generate cmd to power on expander box
        cmd = bridge_setting + ' power on'
        out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(out, 'Expander Box: ' + out)
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(e, True)
        # check if change is triggered
        start = time.time()
        success = False
        while time.time() < start + 10:
            if self.check_expander_status('on') is True:
                success = True
                break
            else:
                time.sleep(1)
        if not success:
            e = "Failed to power on expander"
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(self, e, True)



[docs]    def expander_off(self):
        # get bridge setting
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        # generate cmd to power off expander box
        cmd = bridge_setting + ' power off'
        out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(out, 'Expander Box: ' + out)
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(e, True)
        # check if change is triggered
        start = time.time()
        success = False
        while time.time() < start + 10:
            if self.check_expander_status('off') is True:
                success = True
                break
            else:
                time.sleep(1)
        if not success:
            e = "Failed to power off expander"
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(self, e, True)



[docs]    def check_headnode_status(self, status):
        cmd = ' power status'
        out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
        pass_condition = 'Chassis Power is ' + status.strip()
        if out == pass_condition:
            return True
        else:
            return False



[docs]    def headnode_off(self):
        self.host.oob.power_off()
        powered_off = self.check_headnode_status('off')
        try:
            self.validate_condition(powered_off, "headnode Node: off")
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(e, True)



[docs]    def headnode_on(self):
        # this is a long wait, be patient
        self.host.oob.power_on()
        powered_on = self.check_headnode_status('on')
        try:
            self.validate_condition(powered_on, "headnode Node: on")
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(e, True)



[docs]    def run_check(self):
        # get bridge setting
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        # get errors to filter in dmesg
        error_filter = self.error_filter
        # get GPU count
        gpu_count = self.gpu_count
        # if there are matching number of GPUs
        out = self.host.run("lspci | grep NVIDIA", ignore_status=True)
        num_lines = out.count('NVIDIA')
        try:
            self.validate_condition(num_lines == int(gpu_count),
                                        'Total number of GPU: %s' % out)
        except Exception as e:
            # non-critical error, no need to stop
            self.exception_handler(e, False)

        # getting dmesg log
        cmd = 'dmesg | grep -i error'
        if error_filter != '':
            for item in error_filter.split(','):
                cmd += (' | grep -v ' + item)
        out = self.host.run(cmd, ignore_status=True)
        num_lines = sum(1 for line in out)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(num_lines == 0, 'Kernel error: \n%s' %
                                        out)
        except Exception as e:
            # non-critical error, no need to stop
            self.exception_handler(e, False)

        # generate cmd to check errors on head node
        cmd = 'ipmitool sel elist | grep error'
        out = self.host.run(cmd, ignore_status=True)
        num_lines = sum(1 for line in out)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(num_lines == 0,
                                        'Error in head node: \n%s' % out)
        except Exception as e:
            # non-critical error, no need to sto
            self.exception_handler(e, False)

        # generate cmd to check errors on expander box
        cmd = 'ipmitool ' + bridge_setting + ' sel elist | grep error'
        out = self.host.run(cmd, ignore_status=True)
        num_lines = sum(1 for line in out)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(num_lines == 0,
                                        'Error in expander box: \n%s' % out)
        except Exception as e:
            # non-critical error, no need to sto
            self.exception_handler(e, False)


    # config filter used to test on different servers

[docs]    def get_cycle_config_filter(self):
        cfg_filter = []
        # specify filter name here, define your filter in config_filter.json
        # path: havoc/autotest_testfiles/validation_utils/cfg/config_filter.json
        cfg_filter.append({'filter_name': 'expanderpowercycle'})
        return cfg_filter



[docs]    def ac_cycle_expander(self):
        ac_command = self.ac_command
        # get bridge setting
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        # generate cmd to power on expander box
        cmd = bridge_setting + ' ' + ac_command
        # should have some sort of check on out, currently no return value from
        # running this command, additional change remain to be added in DVT
        out = self.host.oob.run_ipmicmd(cmd)
        try:
            self.validate_condition(True, 'Expander Box AC Cycle: ' + out)
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(e, True)
        start = time.time()
        success = False
        # timeout for bmc unit should be evaluated, subject to change in DVT
        while time.time() < start + 180:
            if self.check_expander_status('on') is True:
                success = True
                break
            else:
                time.sleep(1)
        if not success:
            e = "Failed to AC cycle expander"
            # critical error, must stop
            self.exception_handler(self, e, True)



[docs]    def execute(self):
        bridge_setting = self.bridge_setting
        cycle_count = int(self.cycle_count)
        with_expander = self.with_expander
        cycle_type = self.cycle_type

        # clear initial dmesg through ipmitool on head node
        cmd = 'dmesg -C'
        self.host.run(cmd)

        # clear initial elist through ipmitool on head node
        cmd = 'ipmitool sel clear'
        self.host.run(cmd)

        # clear initial elist through ipmitool on expander box
        cmd = 'ipmitool ' + bridge_setting + ' sel clear'
        self.host.run(cmd, ignore_status=True)

        self.error_counter = 0
        self.err_str = "Found the following errors:\n"
        # get initial configuration that will be diffed later
        try:
            cfg_init = SystemConfig.config_check(self.host)
        except Exception as e:
            # critical error, getting config_check failed
            self.exception_handler(e, True)

        # config filter called here
        cfg_filter = self.get_cycle_config_filter()

        for rounds in range(0, cycle_count):  # noqa: B007 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            # expander should be on before test start
            self.expander_on()
            if str(cycle_type) == "DC":
                # power cycle expander and head node
                if with_expander is True:
                    self.expander_off()
                    self.headnode_off()
                    self.expander_on()
                    self.headnode_on()
                # power cycle only head node
                else:
                    self.headnode_off()
                    self.headnode_on()
            elif str(cycle_type) == "AC":
                self.ac_cycle_expander()
                self.headnode_off()
                self.headnode_on()
            else:
                raise Exception('Unknown value:%s for cycle_type' % cycle_type)
            # run checks at the end
            self.run_check()
            try:
                cfg2 = SystemConfig.config_check(self.host)
            except Exception as e:
                # critical error, getting config_check failed
                self.exception_handler(e, True)
            try:
                SystemConfig.compare_configs(cfg_init, cfg2, cfg_filter)
            except Exception as e:
                # non-critical error, no need to stop
                self.exception_handler(e, False)

        # in the end, if no critical errors ever happened, show whatever
        # non-critical erros encountered
        if self.error_counter > 0:
            raise Exception(self.err_str)




[docs]def main():
    test = ExpanderCycleTest()
    test.lifecycle()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
